definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: A shirt is taken off a threadlike clothes-line.
sentences.chinese: 一件衬衫从晾衣绳上滑落。

sentences.english: Zhang Jingjing has been the face of silent tears fall quietly.
sentences.chinese: 张晶晶脸上无声的泪水已悄然滑落。

sentences.english: A string of rain water slides from leaf Xi and sets aside among two of us just.
sentences.chinese: 一串雨水从叶隙中滑落，恰好在我俩之间划开。

sentences.english: We didn"t just read poetry, we let it drip from our tongues like honey."
sentences.chinese: 咱们不只仅是念诗，诗从咱们舌间滑落，就像蜜糖。

sentences.english: The ice broke into many smaller icebergs after falling into Tasman Lake.
sentences.chinese: 冰川碎成许多小的冰山滑落到塔斯曼湖。

sentences.english: I heard the sweat from my face hit the wooden floors.
sentences.chinese: 汗珠从我的脸上滑落下来，滴在了木地板上。

sentences.english: That's just the way it slides down the pipe sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 就像输送管上有时会出现东西滑落下来的现象。

sentences.english: Lyon slipped to third place, three points behind PSG.
sentences.chinese: 马赛滑落至积分榜中游，7分落后第三名里尔。

sentences.english: Double-loop elastic bands and put them either side of the hanger to keep clothes from falling down.
sentences.chinese: 在衣架两端绕两圈橡皮筋可以防止衣服滑落。

sentences.english: Worried the shade like this, easily falls the eyeground , that kind of cool autumn chill.
sentences.chinese: 一丝愁影就这样，轻易滑落眼底，那种凉凉的秋意。

sentences.english: Sylvia rolled her eyes at me when the books slipped.
sentences.chinese: 西尔维娅在书本滑落的瞬间把目光转向了我。

sentences.english: The watermelon slipped from his hands and fell to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 西瓜从他手里滑落，摔得粉碎。

sentences.english: The glasses slid off the table onto the floor.
sentences.chinese: 玻璃杯子全都从桌上滑落到了地板上。

sentences.english: The cake easily slid out of the pan.
sentences.chinese: 那块薄饼很轻易地从锅里滑落出来。

sentences.english: The dew drop fall into dust from the rose petal , without a sign, disappear.
sentences.chinese: 那晨露从玫瑰瓣上滑落尘土，没有一声叹息，消失了。

sentences.english: The child tipped the plate and the cake fell off it to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子盘子没有端平，蛋糕滑落到地板上了。

definition: to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
